channel.title: No one can connect to my server
channel.description: I have my server ports open and everything someone told me the client might be trying to connect to another ip and the server might be down how do i find that ip and change it to mine.

item.title: No one can connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @PlucScape PlucScape
item.description:
@PlucScape wrote:

RiiPiiNFtW:

If you told us the base it might be a bit useful plus this is in the wrong section. Please read the rules before posting and usehttp://www.moparisthebest.com/Themes/core/images/bbc/img.gif the search bar.

Actually you are only half right.
This isn’t technically the wrong section…
He’s asking for how to ‘run’ his server in the correct way, i suppose.

So here’s my answer anyway:
no-ip.com
http://192.168.2.1/ OR http://192.168.1.1/
AND
http://192.168.0.1/

Finally, http://google.com Lookup RSPS portforwarding. Google gets you anything. Trust me.
So, get it portforwarded correcly, get no-ip and run it properly, make sure your server is compiled and then try to run it anyways.
If not even you can login, you truly have a problem.
Sorry if I couldn’t give you the help sources any further; I just answered to the best of my knowledge.
Thanks for understanding.

Read full topic
